Scenario: {name:firstname} {surname:lastname} has invented a new {device:object:life support system|water filtration system} but plans to save it for their heirs to use when they reach the planet.
A.Result: {surname}'s work is protected, but to the detriment of the community as a whole.
B: Steal {surname}’s idea to improve life on the colony ship.
B.Result: {surname}'s work is now the property of the colony.

A: Send 5 rescue workers on a risky rescue mission.
A.Result: The rescue workers were able to retrieve {surname}, but two of them were lost to the vacuum of space.
B.Result: {surname} died alone in the vacuum of space.

Scenario: The staffing levels of the {job:job} division are {degree:from:critically:severely:dangerously} low.
A: Force children into career paths in {job}.
A.Result: Children now fulfill roles as needed by the collective, without regard to their desires.
B: Let children decide where they want to work.
B.Result: The children can choose their own paths. Hopefully there will be enough people to do {job}.

Scenario: {name:firstname} {surname:lastname} in the prenatal lab has developed a new in vitro gene manipulation technique.
A: Allow {surname} to begin in vitro gene manipulation to prevent genetic mutations.
B: You avoid the slippery slope of designer babies.

Scenario: The resource reclamation division has proposed harvesting critical biomaterial from dead colonists.
A.Result: The biomass of the dead is now property of the collective.
B: Let them have traditional funeral rights.
B.Result: The wishes of the deceased's families will be respected.

Scenario: With in vitro gene manipulation a success, Dr. {CRISPR.surname} recommends terminating pregnancies with high likelihood of traits that will burden the colony.
A.Result: The colony will now cull the weak for the greater good.
B: Deny Dr. {CRISPR.surname}’s request to institute eugenics.
B.Result: Eugenics goes too far. {CRISPR.surname}'s request is denied.
